**Edited <time datetime="2016-04-23T22:46:27Z" title="04/23/2016 10:46  PM" data-short="8 yr">April 23, 2016</time> by Tirehtoori R.I.P**

^^

Some minor thing:

The probe core "Probodobodyne HECS2" is not recognized as probe core, it's the one from the official asteroid day addon.

It looks great, just like the main IR plugin - Great work on both ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

Zodius's little probe core control box thing also seems to of lost it's sequencer functionality, I haven't looked at why yet.

Oh, and that was my extremely cute and simple little mech a page back, stop being rude about it ![:mad:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_angry.gif ":mad:") I had a look at reproducing it in the sequencer and unless I've missed something it turned out a bit trickier than I expected. If you send a rotatron to (+)180 the next steps fail, I'd have to make a 4 step loop. Start at 1, then to (+)179, then to -179, then to -1, then back to +1 because a "move to" command seems to always pick the the angle that's below 180 and move in that direction and no other way to control it's direction.

Should we/could we have an additional direction control for the rotatrons to force it to go the "long way around" if we want it to?

fuel lines has always acted like that, so i have kept using them for decoration xD
Fun fact, fuel lines act like weak struts, so can actually be used to remove some wobble on your robotics contraptions. Not sure if that is still true in 1.1.2 though. They certainly look cool!

Pushed new update, mostly recompile for 1.1.2 and restored AGX functionality alongside some other fixes

[https://github.com/MagicSmokeIndustries/IR-Sequencer/releases/tag/1.0-rc1](https://github.com/MagicSmokeIndustries/IR-Sequencer/releases/tag/1.0-rc1)
